article: It was a bright Saturday morning in the late fall. I had stopped at a caf to enjoy a cup of coffee and _ the morning newspaper. Suddenly, I _ a hand on the back of my jacket and heard someone say, Hey Steve! How ya doin ? _ up, I saw a boy wearing a mechanic s uniform worn by employees of the gasoline station next to the caf . He looked _ , but, at first, I was unable to _ where we had met. He also held a cup of coffee, so I asked him to join me. Very soon, his _ and probably my coffee began to thaw out my _ . Five years earlier, he had been traveling home late on a February night. a fierce _ had arrived that afternoon, and by midnight, the snowdrifts were getting _ . He recalled _ a drift just down the road from my house. He had walked to my house for _ . I had taken my pickup and a tow-rope and _ his car out of the snowdrift and up to the highway where maintenance trucks had _ away the snow. This has been a _ occurrence here during the winter. I cannot _ the times someone has also pulled my car from a snowdrift. _ , it was an unforgettable experience for him, and his memory of our unexpected meeting in a snowstorm _ my entire day. Leo Buscaglia wrote, Too often we underestimate the _ of a touch, a smile, a kind word, a listening ear, an honest compliment, or the smallest act of _ , all of which have the potential to turn a _ around. 1.
